official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 with respect to punitive damages received by private litigants under the Clayton Act.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to exclude from gross income punitive damages (two-thirds of antitrust treble damages) received by a private antitrust litigant, if such litigant brings suit against a particular defendant before the Federal Government institutes criminal proceedings. Disallows tax deductions for antitrust punitive damages paid or incurred by a taxpayer.
